titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Communications Workers of America, Local 1032 Records WAG.128
titlestmt.author: Michael V. D'Ambrosio and Daniel Michelson

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 16:00:45 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Communications Workers of America, Local 1032 Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Communications Workers of America. Local 1032 (Ewing, N.J.)

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: Communications Workers of America. Local 1032 (Ewing, N.J.)

did.abstract: CWA Local 1032 represents about 6,000 workers in a variety of professions and fields in New Jersey state government (especially the Department of Transportation), the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, several New Jersey towns and counties as well as several private sector work sites. Headquartered in Ewing, Local 1032 also has offices in Newark and Newton. The records of CWA Local 1032 document the activities of an important New Jersey local. Executive Board material, including minutes, is especially valuable for understanding 1032. Other material in the collection includes organizing campaign files, correspondence, negotiation files, political campaign files, and grievances.
did.physloc: Materials stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to research visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The records of CWA Local 1032 document the activities of an important New Jersey local. Executive Board material, including minutes, is especially valuable for understanding 1032. Other material in the collection includes organizing campaign files, correspondence, negotiation files, political campaign files, and grievances.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: CWA Local 1032 represents about 6,000 workers in a variety of professions and fields in New Jersey state government (especially the Department of Transportation), the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, several New Jersey towns and counties as well as several private sector work sites. Headquartered in Ewing, Local 1032 also has offices in Newark and Newton. Although most of the Local's membership is from New Jersey, some hail from New York.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Communications Workers of America, Local 1032 Records; WAG 128; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The archived websites were added as a series in 2014.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Jim Marketti, on behalf of the Communications Workers of America, Local 1032, in 2000. The accession number associated with this gift is 1987.014

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the Communications Workers of America, Local 1032, were transferred to New York University in 2000 by Jim Marketti. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2630.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The archived website was migrated from the California Digital Library's Web Archiving Service to the Internet Archive's Archive-It Service in November 2015. The link to California Digital Library was removed in October 2017.

Archived Website

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Communications Workers of America Local 1032 represents about 6,000 workers in a variety of professions and fields in several New Jersey State Departments, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, several New Jersey towns and counties as well as several private sector work sites.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
